data.title: Lilah Mansour, M.D., Austin, TX Gastroenterologist
data.meta_description: Lilah Mansour, M.D. is a board-certified gastroenterologist offering DFW-area individuals personalized GI treatment and advanced techniques. Schedule a consultation with Dr. Mansour today.
data.text:
About Lilah Mansour, M.D.

Dr. Lilah Mansour is a board-certified Gastroenterologist with Texas Digestive Disease Consultants. She performs routine GI procedures such as upper endoscopy and colonoscopy in the diagnosis, screening and surveillance of gastrointestinal diseases and cancers. In addition, she specializes in all aspects of Gastroenterology, and also performs endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography (ERCP) for biliary disorders, esophageal dilation for strictures, and hemorrhoidal banding. She is fluent in English and is a member of the American College of Gastroenterology, the Texas Medical Association, and the Travis County Medical Society.

Education

Undergraduate: University of Texas at Austin

Medical School: Louisiana State University Medical School in Shreveport

Residency: University of Florida in Gainesville

Fellowship: University of Oklahoma in Oklahoma City

Why did you choose to specialize in Gastroenterology?

I specialized in gastroenterology because I am fascinated by the variety of interesting diseases we diagnose and the technical expertise required to perform our procedures. Additionally, I am drawn to the fact that gastroenterologists prescribe a balance of preventive care and treatment to help our patients. From treating common digestive issues, like indigestion and irregularity, to helping patients stay healthy by screening for colon cancer, I am grateful for the opportunity to help my patients with their health and well-being.

Do you have a specialty of interest in Gastroenterology?

I enjoy all aspects of gastroenterology.

What do you and your family enjoy doing in your spare time?

I enjoy spending time with my family, being active and outdoors, and visiting the sights and scenes of Austin. From seeing the Texas Longhorns compete to visiting local food joints and restaurants, there is always something fun to do here in Austin.
